title: Lucien Lardy 2016 Les Thorins  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: This structured wine comes from a single parcel in Moulin-à-Vent. Packed with both tannins and black-plum fruits, it is ripe, fruity and crisp. Drink from late 2018.

title: Michel & Stéphane Ogier 2014 La Combe de Malleval  (Condrieu)
description: Pronounced earth tones on the first whiff dissipate with aeration to reveal a complex array of tropical fruit and floral aromas. Rich and broad on the palate, this wine offers a lavish concoction of sun-kissed tangerine, pineapple and peach flavors kissed with vanilla and spice. The finish is a touch warming but silken and expansive.

title: Mommessin 2016 Les Grandes Mises Les Charmes  (Morgon)
description: A powerful core of wood aging makes this a dry, solid wine that has excellent aging potential. Black cherries and spice contrast with the rich structure. From one of the top sectors of Morgon, the wine will be best drunk from 2019.

title: Mt. Brave 2014 Merlot (Mount Veeder)
description: Largely structured and weighty, this well-made wine is youthful in its grippy tannins and full embrace of huckleberry and black-cherry fruit, the exuberance tempered by complements of black licorice and toasted oak. This will be happy in the cellar; enjoy best 2024–2029.

title: Mt. Difficulty 2014 Bannockburn Pinot Noir (Central Otago)
description: This wine is alluring in aromas of black olive, raw meat, wet earth and stewed raspberry. The palate is satiny in feel, with well-balanced acidity and savory, olivey tannins. Drink now–2020.

title: Mullineux 2015 Old Vines White (Swartland)
description: This Chenin Blanc-based blend, with 12% Clairette, 6% Viognier, 4% Grenache Blanc and 4% Sémillon, opens with medium-intense aromas of apple skin, melon rind, honeysuckle, strawberry hull and orange pith. The full, medium-weight palate boasts ample acidity to complement the rich beeswax, orange oil and pressed flower tones, with a softly pithy texture that lends structure and length to the enduring finish. It's drinkable now, but should benefit from some additional maturity. Drink 2020–2024.

title: Notre Dame de Cousignac 2014 Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: While bold in frame and body, this lusciously fruity wine offers structure and balance as well. Plush dark cherry and preserved-strawberry flavors envelope the palate, juxtaposed by hits of spice and leather. The finish is long and warming but lingers pleasantly with fine, persistent tannins and a spicy licorice note. Drink through 2030.

title: Paris Valley Road 2014 Zinfandel (California)
description: Full bodied and nicely dry, this well-built wine starts with smoky black-pepper aromas that lead to mouthfilling blackberry and black-cherry flavors supported by firm tannins. It's the kind of wine that will pair beautifully with a meaty or cheesy meal, because it has the texture to match that kind of richness.

title: Pence Ranch 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is a great and extremely fairly priced taste of what the Pence team is up to on the eastern edge of the appellation. Sweet sandalwood, red plum, mulberry, black tea, juniper and a hint of maple show on the nose. The palate combines tart black-plum skins with cherry tomato and dewy garden-herb flavors.

title: Peter Franus 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: From a single site in Carneros, the Stewart Vineyard, this wine is exuberant in red fruit, with a sly hint of tobacco and tomato leaf. Big ripe tannins wrap around a meaty side show of garrigue and black pepper, finishing in elegant ripeness.

title: R&A; Pfaffl 2016 Goldjoch Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)
description: The perfume of very ripe, yellow pear and the salty tang of miso are equally strong on the nose of this wine. They continue their contrasting play on the palate, where chervil, pepper and soy savoriness takes over. Pithy citrus and a lots of midpalate texture leave a lasting impression.

title: Raymond 2014 Salon Privé Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made predominantly from Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this bold full-bodied blend is invitingly floral in cherry blossom and coconut flakes, the oak showy and present. Cherry and cassis flavors are rounded and rich on the palate and the body brawny and broadly defined in tannin and oak.

title: Salvestrin 2013 Three D Dr. Crane Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: This is a lightly spiced 100% varietal wine from a famous site, a showcase of burly black cherry seasoned in cedar, graphite and vanilla. Full bodied, it holds its ripeness well, integrating the weight into a graceful package of understated power.

title: Schiavenza 2013 del Comune di Serralunga d'Alba  (Barolo)
description: Rose petal, new leather, forest floor and balsamic whiffs of menthol take the lead on this youthfully austere red. Linear and vibrant, the full-bodied palate delivers Marasca cherry, orange zest, cinnamon, licorice and an earthy hint of game. Bright acidity and taut tannins provide an age-worthy structure. Fans of classic of Barolo will love this. Drink 2023–2938.

title: Schwarzböck 2016 Aichleiten Riesling (Niederösterreich)
description: This wine's wet earth-laden nose is wonderfully framed by fresh lemon notes. The palate has bright, lemony concentration and appetizing freshness. There's something sunny and joyful about this. The finish is zesty and long. Delicious now, it has the potential to age. Drink 2018–2028.

title: Sepp Moser 2016 Ried Schnabel Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: This wine's fresh, juicy yellow pear-inflected nose has a touch of ripe cantaloupe and an herbal hint of conifer. The palate continues with intriguing notes of fir honey but gives the starring role to ripe pear and fresh apple notes. It's lithe and fresh, always with that heady hint of honey.

title: Steininger 2016 Grand Grü Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: This wine's subdued nose just hints at pear and yeast. The palate combines fresh, pure green pear fruit with a slightly textured, sonorous hint of sage and soy-scented yeast. The overall tone is one of wonderfully rich pear fruit.

title: Tinhof 2016 Neuburger (Leithaberg)
description: A wonderfully tangy note of cress and lime peel creates an unusual but very appetizing nose in this wine. The slender palate adds lemony freshness and a mineral tone reminiscent of wet pebbles. A lovely, clear-cut example of the variety, with gentle but pristine flavors and a refreshing finish. Lovely now, it's sure to round out in the coming years. Drink 2018–2026.

title: Vidal-Fleury 2014  Condrieu
description: Honeycomb and marzipan accent bright tangerine and peach flavors in this delectably silken sip. It's unctuous and plush in mouthfeel but balanced firmly with sunny citrus acidity and airy plumes of violet and honeysuckle florals.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Hirsch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: As the last bottling of this vineyard from this producer, this is a fine way to go out. It's a salty, gravelly and complex red, aromatic in rose, lavender and orange blossom. Tart acidity uplifts the weightier aspect of the present tannins, as dried herb, sea spray and black tea season the fruit.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Williams Selyem Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From the site around the winery on Westside Road—which is planted to heirloom clones—this wine has a refrained, balanced approach to ripeness, showing focused black cherry, black tea and baked rhubarb tones. The moderate structure allows for a soft, layered texture that could use more time in bottle. Enjoy best from 2020–2025.

title: Winzer Krems 2016 Kremser Wachtberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: This wine's nose is dominated by the scent of freshly cut russet pear but also has a streak of citrus pith. That pithiness makes itself felt on the palate, where it's joined by bright, inviting lemon notes and rich, textured, yeasty savor. A wonderfully concentrated wine with an earthy edge.

title: Zenaida Cellars 2015 Knucklehead Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: There's an impressive density of aromas on this bottling, with black pepper, roasted meat, black currant and tar, yet with a fresh violet kick as well. The concentrated black currant and elderberry flavors are thick on the palate yet cut by tangy black plum skins, salt and pepper and dried herb flavors.

title: Artisan Wines DI Franz Scheider 2015 Reserve Zweigelt (Neusiedlersee)
description: This wine is very aromatic on the nose in notes of dark mulberry and tangy nettle. The palate has the same intensity of fruit and herb—concentrated but not heavy, full-bodied without being rich. This strikes a most lovely balance and convinces with freshness.

title: Ascheri 2013 Coste & Bricco  (Barolo)
description: Classic Nebbiolo aromas of perfumed red berry, fragrant blue flower, cake spice and a whiff of new leather come together on this. Youthfully tight, the vibrant palate evokes red cherry, cranberry, star anise and pipe tobacco framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance and energy. It's still young and tense so give it time to fully develop. Drink 2023–2033.

title: Ashes & Diamonds 2015 Blanc No. 1 White (Napa Valley)
description: This is a blend of equal parts Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc, barrel-fermented and aged in 40% new French oak for one year. It's fresh and alive in orange blossom aromatics and strong impressions of peach, pear and green apple. A bold streak of minerality gives it a hint of gravel and rock.

title: Clos des Fous 2014 Cauquenina Viñas Viejas de Cauquenes Red (Chile)
description: Traditional herbal berry and olive aromas are ideal for an old-vines Cauquenes red like this. In the mouth, this Malbec blend is flush and chewy. Blackberry, spice and toast flavors finish with power and an overriding sense of balanced ripeness. Drink through 2021.

title: Collin-Bourisset 2016 Les Grands Cras  (Morgon)
description: From the Grand Cras vineyard, this wine is powered by firm tannins and a strongly mineral texture. Its rich red fruits are right there, developing well. Age this powerful wine and drink from 2019.

title: Craggy Range 2014 Te Muna Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Martinborough)
description: Ripe red berries, cola, chocolate, florals and a meaty baseline shine through on both the nose and the palate. This is juicy and fruity, with silky smooth tannins, a savory backbone and and an easy-going elegance. Simultaneously glug worthy and serious.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2013 Old Vines Merlot (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine is deep in fruit flavors, and has impressive structure in terms of extraction, body and an abundance of fine-grained tannin. It brings soft black cherry and cedar to the aroma, dark chocolate and blueberry to the palate and coats the mouth with a firm but velvety texture. Best after 2020.
